title: Three-Color DFS Cycle Detection
description: Interactive vis-network visualization demonstrating the three-color DFS algorithm for detecting cycles in directed graphs, specifically for validating learning graph DAG structure
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: algorithms
graph theory
cycle detection
depth-first search
learning graphs
DAG validation

controls.navigation_buttons: Zoom and pan the network view
controls.legend: Shows the three colors (White, Gray, Black) and their meanings
controls.stack_display: Shows the current DFS traversal stack
controls.cycle_alert: Highlights when a cycle is detected with explanation

learningObjectives: Understand the key concepts of three-color dfs cycle detection
Explore three-color dfs cycle detection through interactive visualization
Apply knowledge of three-color dfs cycle detection to solve problems
Test understanding of three-color dfs cycle detection through interactive exercises
